in other news I almost contacted my ex yesterday
:ctwokinds-zenshocked:*[The finest pillows in all the lands]
That sounds like a story, Kiwi
Sounds like a bad idea avoided.
bored and lonely & I saw he was online so I had a smol part inside suggest starting a conversation
then my common sense heard & beat it back into its cage
it hasn’t escaped my notice that the day his mom messaged me for the random catch up, it was his birthday
that’s a mighty hard hmmmmm there rough
My bear nose smells a mystery!
sometimes exes can be good friends. no idea how you two were
it’s just after 5 years of s i l e n c e, where do you start talking again and why
yeaah that's hard to figure out. awkward galore?
I did message him awhile back that a family member of his had friended me and I suspected it wasn’t actually them but I never got a response so I reported it and moved on
Eh. Don't know you're situation, but a round of "sorries" couldn't hurt after 5 years apart
and then however long later he responds with this like he was just getting the message, which is possible
Shoot, drifted off to sleep. I'll need to catch the replay
sorries don’t apply as far as I know
not as long as it’s been, and I’m the one that broke it off

we didn’t break off gracefully but the flames did extinguish after awhile between the family members
Kiwi, I'm there as well. My ex told me that she didn't think she wanted to be with me anymore, so I packed my things up and left.
it’s not that I wanted to leave at the time - I liked him
Re: Sometimes stuff just doesn't work
It's been hard mostly because I haven't found someone new to fill the void.
but my mom didn’t & I’m not sure if some of his family was keen on it either
It's your life to live, no one else's.
Yeah sounds like a big dose of not their business
When you become of legal age, your life is your own.
well long story short a big mess happened senior prom night & I decided I was done with the fits between everyone that had their noses in a pot that wasn’t theirs
told him we’d be better off apart, more or less
but it was his grandma that had called my mom cussing her out for trying to call his mom to ask why he hadn’t worn a suit
like a real life romeo and juliet, but the happy ending where nobody dies
Two families, both alike in drama
I have unsolicited advice if you're interested, Kiwi
I talk about it alot but it’s just a story to tell at this point
No, it's not right for me to push it on you.
I’d told him he didn’t have to go if he didn’t want to & I may have wanted him to but his logic was “if I don’t go you’ll be mad”
Just know that you made a good choice, IMO.

High school sweethearts that maintain a successful relationship are rarer than hen's teeth
we dated for 5 years & with how we ended up apart, it definitely would’ve ended but if we’d stayed together...
If you stayed together, you'd both be miserable.
Eh who knows. Thus is life
I was more reserved then but I most definitely had and have a temper
I helped at the church often
Something something youth and a learning experience had
I was part of the youth choir and theater group if that’s what you want to call it so I didn’t have much of a choice really, to help with events
that’s where we met & he was over one day we were setting up for one & I don’t remember what it was or how it started but there was a light bickering going on
I’m generally mild when I argue, and it was either that or the argument but he turned off & went to go outside for whatever reason
and he punched a pew on the way out
No! What if jesus was sitting there?!
so I stood, and said very evenly but loud enough to hear that if that’s how he wanted to act he could leave and not come back
He'll just turn the other cheek
I was in the main area of course with him alone setting up my laptop for the projector & the rest of the crew was a door away in the kitchen/dining area
I put what I was working on down and went in there with them & everyone obviously knew something was up because they moved out of my way
and sure enough, he was close behind me
Kiwi, cut yourself some slack. You were both young.
I started helping the director put up his decor he was working on and just gave him the cold shoulder
I wasn’t being unreasonable, though you could say I was being rude or mean
I was staying quiet to return to the discussion when he wasn’t punching things
How many things did he punch?
Then we go get a snack
I have to go, everyone have a good night/day
my dad was an abusive alcoholic before he died & he knew this
if you think throwing or punching shit will get you anywhere with me, it’ll get you sent out the door on your ass
Punching things is no good. I'm actually a very nonconfrontational bear irl
But yeah. Punching things bad. Abusive drunks suck
My best friend had an emotionally abusive drunkard of a dad and he messed her up for years
He also spent all of our high school trying to get a seperation from her so he didn't have to pay child support any more
I didn't know you could divorce your kids before that
just how does someone drop to that level
He was a real piece of shit

that was an instance in the middle of dating
Well either way, punching stuff is no good
you have so much free time

I work then I come here
then I pop in on break & lunch

as I’ve read, punching walls & breaking stuff and the raising voice are the beginnings of abuse
it’s considered domestic abuse at that point even if they’re not hitting or making contact with you - it’s intimidation
Glad I no longer do that and found ways to calm down.

you can sit in a corner until you can talk like a regular human adult
